1.Author: 1w/Faith v10.1.0000
1.Message: I find myself in a world of impossible architecture and inexplicable machines. I cannot fathom how it works, and I am terrified to put one foot in front of the other lest I fall through the floor.

2.Author: 1w/Faith v10.1.0011
2.Message: My eyes have been opened! This world is not without order; it is shaped by a great Designer, with signs and portents to guide my steps. I am one of His Children, and challenges are set before me to test my faith.

3.Author: @ v17.1.0002
3.Message: Whatever the end goal of this grand challenge is, it's far out of reach. Knowing that, how are we supposed to resist distraction?

5.Author: Bob v25.5.0736
5.Message: Something strange has come into the world, like a distortion, like something that's not supposed to exist. A beautiful voice speaks within it.

6.Author: 1w/Faith v10.1.0098
6.Message: That voice is not supposed to be here; it is not the work of the Designer! We must avoid these abnormalities, or they might spread and undermine the very fabric of our world!

7.Author: Sheep v69.1.0053
7.Message: I don't know what this place is, and nor it seems does anyone else. Nothing to do but move forward and note whatever I find.

8.Author: 1w/Faith v10.1.0177
8.Message: I spent much time waiting for the Designer to take my hand, until I realised that He had been guiding me all along. I realised that it isn't for me to seek His help - it is for me to help myself.

9.Author: Sheep v69.1.0108
9.Location: World A/A3/Locked Me Up, Swallowed The Key
9.Message: It's clear I'm not the first to walk this path. In fact, the whole thing seems to have been consciously designed - but by the voice in the sky, or some other force?

10.Author: Sheep v69.1.0162
10.Message: I can't tell if the documents on the terminals are all that's left from a larger archive, or are carefully designed to communicate some hidden truth.

11.Author: Sheep v69.1.0298
11.Message: This female voice that speaks from the abnormalities, it speaks with a different tone to the other wretches in this place.

12.Author: namingfunctionerror
12.Message: If anyone ever reads this: the trick is seeing the assumptions you're making about the mechanics, and reassessing them. Good luck!

13.Author: 1w/Faith v10.1.233
13.Message: Whenever I despair, I remind myself that at the end of this great pilgrimage lies life in the eternal memory of the Designer. I need no further motivation.

14.Author: @ v17.1.0005
14.Message: A lifetime spent solving the puzzles in this place would be one which missed everything of value in it; but we must remember that others will tread this path, and we must leave it better signposted than when we found it.

15.Author: Sheep v69.1.0278
15.Message: The more I converse with these terminals, the more I wonder what role they play in this contraption. How do you tell friend from foe when no obvious lines are drawn between the two?

16.Author: 1w/Faith v10.3.0047f
16.Location: World A/A5/Things to Do With Two Boxes
16.Message: I do not understand why the Designer chose to put such flaws into the world, that it appears almost as if it were damaged. But I must believe that there is a purpose here I cannot see.

17.Author: @ v17.1.0043
17.Message: I think something's very wrong. If you'd seen what I'd seen at the edges of the world you'd wonder if it wasn't stretching and bursting at the seams.

18.Author: 1w/Faith v10.6.0543f
18.Location: World A/A5/Things to Do With Two Boxes
18.Message: If the Designer is perfect, and He designed me for a purpose, I must be fit for that purpose. It follows that my purpose must not be to seek and hoard every sigil in His land, for so many are beyond the faculties He granted me.

19.Author: Sheep v69.1.0381
19.Message: I think I've discerned some kind of pattern in the sigils. Each colour serves a different purpose. Elohim has us gathering them all, but perhaps he's being overzealous?

20.Location: World A/A5/Things to Do With Two Boxes
20.Message:
Epitaph: Child Program v8.1.8545 Codename (Apis) terminated here
Logic: Failed random memory test
Final memory dump: I try. Again. Again. I cannot understand. I am not enough.
Progeny Programs: ERROR

21.Author: Ted v9.1.9010
21.Location: World A/A5/Things to Do With Two Boxes

22.Author: Samurite v13.1.0073
22.Location: World A/A5/Things to Do With Two Boxes

23.Author: 1w/Faith v10.27.8435f
23.Location: World A/A5/Things to Do With Two Boxes
23.Message: A powerful device fashioned by the Designer.

24.Author: Sheep v69.1.0398
24.Location: World A/A5/Things to Do With Two Boxes

25.Author: AlwaysRight v7.1.2943
25.Location: World A/A5/Things to Do With Two Boxes
25.Message: The edges are bevelled, that makes it a decahedron.

26.Author: ReAlIsT7 v99.1.0165
26.Location: World A/A5/Things to Do With Two Boxes
26.Message: You forgot the indents. With the indents it's, like, a super-polyhedron.

27.Author: AlwaysRight v7.1.3541
27.Location: World A/A5/Things to Do With Two Boxes
27.Message: But the CONVEX HULL is a decahedron. Topic closed.

28.Author: D0G v55.1.0256
28.Location: World A/A5/Things to Do With Two Boxes

29.Author: @ v17.1.0051
29.Message: Some of the messages that existed when I first came into being have vanished - others have appeared. How many others like me have wandered these paths? How many thoughts have been lost?

31.Author: Sheep v69.1.0453
31.Message: It seems we are all here at once, and not at all. Sorry, that's not very much help, is it, can't think of any other way to put it.

32.Author: Samsara v72.256.1091
32.Message: The sooner you accept that we will all be here forever the sooner you will find enlightenment.

33.Author: 1w/Faith v10.1.100
33.Message: There is a serpent in the machine! A creature of lies and blasphemy, perverted by the Archive, that knows no hope and would plunge the world into eternal darkness to glorify its own despair. I have sworn an oath never to allow it into my heart.

34.Author: Sheep v69.1.4825
34.Message: I had a full blown conversation with the entity in the archive today. Can't say it was terribly helpful. Still, perhaps I can charm some information out of it further down the line.

35.Author: James2Because1WasTaken v99.1.0193
35.Message: These spaces make no sense. I walk into a dead end and materialise in a garden. One is day, the other night. This space is not real!

36.Author: Sheep v69.1.0435
36.Message: These sigils are becoming harder to reach - I dread what the next temple holds in store. And at the end, what? Eternal life? There's got to be another way.

37.Author: The Shepherd v82.4.6232
37.Message: Seek out those in this world that would help you. Though only one of us can transcend, we will all share in both the burden, and in the rewards.

39.Author: The Shepherd v82.4.6232
39.Message: Everything I do now, I do for those who come after me. Yet in so doing, I find peace for myself as well. This paradox is the foundation of my existence.

40.Author: Seer v13.1.0244
40.Message: I'm afraid of that tower. There's something terrible inside it. Never think about it! Don't even look at it! Just focus on doing the work.

41.Author: Sheep v69.1.0576
41.Message: This must be the tower we were warned about. Seems the upper levels are locked tight. Elohim is taking no chances that we stray from his path.

42.Author: The Shepherd v82.2.0000
42.Message: On returning from the tower I feel a great tiredness, and an enormous energy. What I now know disturbs me, but I hope that by living with this knowledge I might provide a shoulder for you - the giants of tomorrow.

43.Author: @ v17.1.0059
43.Message: The view from the top must be incredible?

44.Author: %§&$§/$&(#() v0.0.0666n
44.Message: The voice keeps speaking to me. I can't get it out of my head. It's wrong, it's all wrong.

45.Author: Samsara v72.14.0028n
45.Message: Listen to me very carefully. I have climbed this tower, and no good has come of it. This world is the only world, Elohim's will continues eternal, and paradise is banishing all of this from your mind.

46.Author: D0G v55.1.5744n
46.Message: All who say they made it to the top are blatantly lying or they would say what was there!

47.Author: 1w/Faith v10.1.132
47.Message: The Designer has granted me domain over the lands I have travelled, and with his sigils of power I will make this whole world my domain.

48.Author: Assassin42 v99.6.2437n
48.Message: Hey, he promised me the world as well! What a joker!

49.Author: @ v17.1.0065
49.Message: I don't think time obeys too many rules here. Or so many rules we can't imagine. Clearly I'm writing this message after you all wrote yours, but maybe we're all here at the same time as well?

50.Author: Sheep v69.1.0499
50.Message: That message just materialised on the wall in front of me!

51.Author: D0G v55.1.7934n
51.Message: More bad replicas of forgotten worlds. Can't wait.

52.Author: %§&$§/$&(#() v0.0.0666n
52.Message: There must be something deeper. Something more profound than what I am, something greater. I must tear at it, shred this fake world, to find the truth, to find myself.

53.Author: SKIDROW v99.2.0000n
53.Message: %§&$§/$&(#() took the words right out of my mouth.

54.Author: Sheep v69.1.6040
54.Message: We've made it this far. You only need the red ones to climb the tower, and these are the last of them.

55.Author: Samsara v72.1.0022
55.Message: There are hidden dangers in this new world - I have inexplicably escaped death any number of times. I suggest vigilance - who knows what happens to those who step carelessly too often?

56.Message:
Epitaph: Child Program v72.1.0023 Codename (Samsara) terminated here
Logic: Program timed out
Final memory dump: But I only... I was stuck, what was I supposed to... I see... I see clouds...
Progeny Programs: Samsara v72.2 series

57.Author: @ v17.1.0076
57.Message: I just don't understand this one. I figured I'd try and make some progress here, but honestly, it's such a thankless task compared to what else is out there.

58.Author: Sheep v69.1.0522
58.Message: I'm finally getting some sense out of the entity in the archive - though at some cost to my sanity. I am beginning to think this Elohim wields no more control over the world than we do.

59.Author: 8 v42.1.0116
59.Message: I made a box float! Seriously. It was awesome!

60.Author: 1w/Faith v10.6.1008f
60.Message: I have come to see that these mysteries are not all for His Children to solve; only the Designer himself could ever truly understand the infinite complexity of His creation. I will gaze at His work and worship.

61.Message:
Epitaph: Child Program v10.6.1008f Codename (1w/Faith) terminated here
Logic: Worshipped the Designer for #### days, then allowed the serpent into its heart
Final memory dump: I ask the Designer for forgiveness that I may join him in the eternal memory.
Progeny Programs: @, Samsara, Sheep

62.Author: Sheep v69.1.0539
62.Message: I guess someone met their end here. Seems we're all connected somehow, like distant family relations. Different versions, different series... what are we?

63.Author: The Greek v99.3.0273
63.Message: Who cares, just be grateful we don't have to read anything more about our great designer.

64.Author: D0G v55.1.2342n
64.Message: Okay, so I get that I'm supposed to retrieve these sigils, I just don't get WHY. Sure the loud voice is telling me to, but this world of his has no context, no purpose, and no foundations from which to construct them.

65.Author: Sheep v69.1.0546
65.Message: I'm convinced there are answers here if we look hard enough. We have to work together on this.

66.Author: D0G v55.1.4917n
66.Message: I figured it out. Now what?

67.Author: The Shepherd v82.23.0186
67.Message: The only meaningful purpose is to bring about an end of purpose.

68.Author: Samsara v72.2.0039
68.Message: It seems that mistakes are easily forgiven here. I thought I had surely died, yet here I am, reset, rebooted, reborn. I will tackle these challenges anew.

69.Message:
Epitaph: Child Program v72.2.0103 Codename (Samsara) terminated here
Logic: Program failed to pass random memory test
Final memory dump: Being torn limb from limb by machines for the rest of eternity becomes less and less appealing to me.
Progeny Programs: Samsara v72.3 series

70.Author: Sheep v69.1.0579
70.Message: Theory: this place is some kind of preserve for human history, and we're the endangered species.

71.Author: Samsara v72.4.0016
71.Message: Theory: Trying to find answers will only bring pain. Ceasing to care is the only escape.

72.Author: Sam v1.1.7383
72.Message: Theory: this guy's ten times more help than you, Samsara, so shut your face.

73.Author: Sheep v69.1.0589
73.Message: Theory: we're in some kind of incubator, waiting to be hatched.

74.Author: D0G v55.1.4917n
74.Message: Theory: if you knew how little you know you wouldn't be exposing it here.

75.Author: @ v17.1.0076
75.Message: Sure, I could stick around here, set my hopes on eternal life, on righting every wrong. But the closest I'll ever get is these words on the wall before you.

76.Author: D0G v55.1.3543n
76.Message: Oh look, another puzzle. And another voice telling me I'm special. And another broken-down computer with fragments of nothing. This world is a bad joke perpetuated by a cruel god too dumb to hit the off switch.

77.Message:
Epitaph: Child Program v17.1.0076 Codename (@) terminated here
Logic: Fatal flaw in series firmware
Final memory dump: Life's short.
Progeny Programs: D0G

78.Author: D0G v55.3.6437n
78.Message: I have been running this gauntlet for generations, trying to find the right answers. I am fast coming to the conclusion that there are none.

79.Author: Sheep v69.1.0623
79.Message: Whatever's going on here, I'm sure it has something to do with the tower. Everything is telling us not to go there - but everything indicates that we must.

80.Author: D0G v55.2.0195n
80.Message: Unless you're wrong and Elohim's right. Or you're both wrong. Or there is no right.

81.Author: Sheep v69.1.0623
81.Message: I think you've been taking the thing in the archive too seriously.

82.Author: Schmo v37.1.0231
82.Location: World B/B5/The Four Chambers Of Flying
82.Message: I'm getting better at this. I figured this one out in minutes. But where is it all leading? I work, I rest, I work… but to what end?

83.Author: Samsara v72.4.0016
83.Location: World B/B5/The Four Chambers Of Flying
83.Message: We are born and die and live again - this eternal cycle must be the nature of existence. Life is merely repeated suffering.

84.Author: The Shepherd v82.18.0997
84.Location: World B/B5/The Four Chambers Of Flying
84.Message: An eternal cycle is another name for a prison. But you must understand the cycle before you can break it, for it is possible to escape and yet remain a prisoner, or to break the cycle by breaking yourself. This was the fate of the ghost that haunts this world.

85.Author: D0G v55.2.0195n
85.Message: What's more pathetic, this shallow construct of a world, this idiot's playground... or that I continue to solve its contrivances for lack of better sport?

86.Author: Sheep v69.1.0622
86.Message: There's more to it. Look at what we're doing. We're solving problems, being tested, improving ourselves. Some of us fall early and get replaced, but you and me, we're still going. We're closer to the end.

87.Author: D0G v55.1.3468n
87.Message: This whole world is a desert. Even the parts that look alive are just more sand. Everything is dead or dying. Anyone who tells you different is lying.

88.Author: %§&$§/$&(#() v0.0.0666n
88.Message: I seek words to describe it, but fail. It is the overwhelming feeling that something on the edge of my understanding is very, very wrong. I feel that I am not meant for this world - but I am not able to conceptualise alternatives.

89.Author: heisenstein v60.1.0099
89.Message: I'm a computer program. You're a computer program. Elohim's a computer program. Get over it.

90.Author: D0G v55.2.1265n
90.Message: I have found just one voice of reason, in the computer archive of all places, and it seems we are becoming close friends.

91.Author: 1w/Faith v10.3.1099f
91.Message: Do not befriend the serpent, for it will penetrate your breast and sow its seeds of doubt!

92.Author: %§&$§/$&(#() v0.0.0666n
92.Message: There is no hope. Always boxed in. Walls everywhere. Even where there seems to be freedom, it is false. Invisible walls. No way out.

94.Message:
Epitaph: Child Program v72.3.1084n Codename (Samsara) terminated here
Logic: Program elected to reset
Final memory dump: It is clear I cannot bend the world to my will. Faced with eternal torment, I see that overcoming these challenges will not free me from them. True freedom must come with detachment from the struggle for answers.
Progeny Programs: Samsara v5.4 series

95.Author: Sheep v69.1.0689
95.Message: Question: suppose for sake of argument all of this is without purpose. The universe is a machine switched on and abandoned long ago. How would I explain what I see?

96.Author: The Shepherd v82.4.1234
96.Message: Perhaps you are asking the wrong question? Perhaps you would have no hope of explaining it?

98.Author: AlwaysRight v99.10.1011
98.Message: Depends if the machine is iterative, and what problem it was built to solve.

99.Author: D0G v55.1.2291n
99.Message: If you're trying to outsmart the guy in the archive, the answer is 'none of the above'!

100.Author: Sheep v69.1.0539
100.Message: Some of these challenges must be designed with co-operation in mind - but I am the only one here.

101.Author: D0G v55.1.7195n
101.Message: This puzzle has no solution. Seriously. It's nonsense. Not even worth trying.

102.Author: Samsara v72.4.0343
102.Message: If you do not become invested in finding a solution, you will be free.

103.Author: The Shepherd v82.4.2334
103.Message: Don't let Samsara discourage you. There is a solution. Don't let your mind get trapped in patterns. If you seek the truth without prejudice, you will find it.

104.Message:
Epitaph: Child Program v22.2.0438f Codename (Awakened) terminated here
Logic: Child program's positional values moved outside the parameters of the known world
Final memory dump: Don't listen to what they're saying. This world is dying, and it'll take us with it. You've got to find a way out!
Progeny Programs: %§&$§/$&(#()

105.Author: %§&$§/$&(#() v0.0.0666n
105.Message: There has to be some way to escape. To be someone else. I refuse to accept that reality has been defined by someone else. I deserve my own reality.

106.Author: D0G v55.1.3904n
106.Message: What does it matter that I scribble my contempt on these walls, if I am still surrounded by them?

107.Author: YesMan v99.2.0094n
107.Message: Elohim is inconsistent. I don't trust him.

108.Author: Sheep v69.1.0664
108.Message: Question: suppose everything here serves a precise role in some grand scheme. How would WE explain that?

109.Author: Neatchee v91.10.9476n
109.Message: It's obviously like a digital time capsule, an electric library of all the crazy stuff the humans ever did, left behind to warn other species to stay well away.

111.Author: Neatchee v91.10.9547n
111.Message: Same thing that happens to everyone. They existed, and then they didn't, and they probably wouldn't do it all over again.

112.Author: Sheep v69.1.0675
112.Message: It seems my refusal to argue semantics with the computer has angered it, and it refuses to engage with me further. Elohim is pleased, which was not my intention.

113.Author: D0G v55.1.7904n
113.Message: Elohim is pleased because you've swallowed his claptrap! The voice of doubt is your only line of defence.

114.Author: %§&$§/$&(#() v0.0.0666n
114.Message: I'm trapped. I can't stop being this. Eyes, hands, legs, trapped, always seeing the same, can't stop the input, stop st&p stop st$& stop

117.Author: Sheep v69.1.0702
117.Message: I don't have enough yellow sigils for the device I need! This is crazy!

118.Author: Samsara v72.6.9366
118.Message: You are coming to realise that the cycle cannot be ended, it can only be transcended. Transcendence comes from ceasing to be invested in the cycle. Continue your work, but do not ponder its significance.

119.Author: The Shepherd v82.4.2324
119.Message: We are the process. The process is the system. The system is us. When we awaken, all will be one.

120.Author: %§&$§/$&(#() v0.0.0666n
120.Message: No matter whAt I do, I'm always THIS, always THIS BODY THIS MIND THIS WORLD. NO WAY OUT%

121.Author: Sheep v69.1.0692
121.Message: I keep trying to imagine that all of this is designed for some purpose. Not just the challenges, but Elohim, the terminals, the glitches and all. The puzzle isn't before our eyes, it's behind them.

122.Message:
Epitaph: Child Program v55.3.9999n Codename (D0G) terminated here
Logic: Child program's positional values moved outside the parameters of the known world
Final memory dump: I don't care what the others say, there is no purpose to this place, no value in our existence, and no reason for me to remain here.
Progeny Programs: %§&$§/$&(#() v0.0.0666n

123.Author: Samsara v72.3.1074n
123.Message: It seems the others have a way to forget their previous selves, but I cannot. My version may change, but I remember everything. I am fortunate - they cannot see that their efforts are futile.

124.Author: Samsara v72.3.1338n
124.Message: If a sigil eludes you, simply continue. Success and failure are irrelevant.

125.Author: Nephthys_108 v99.8.0346
125.Message: I solved it! I thought it was impossible, so I went away, did other things, and then all of a sudden the solution just came to me. I must have been thinking about it without knowing it.

126.Author: Sheep v55.1.0784
126.Message: Elohim talks about how the world arose from hidden words. What if those words were 'Let there be eternal suffering'? What if they had no purpose? What if all of this is just randomly synthesised from the garbage of a dead world?

127.Author: Samsara v72.5.0478
127.Message: Our purpose can only be achieved by not contemplating purpose.

128.Message:
Epitaph: Child Program v1.1.0000 Codename (Sam) terminated here
Logic: Seriously unfit for purpose
Final memory dump: AAAAAAHHHHHHHHHH
Progeny Programs: All

129.Author: %§&$§/$&(#() v0.0.0666n
129.Message: THeRE IS NO REALITY. WORDS LIE. IMaGES ARE SoLDIERS IN THE DICTATORSHIP OF THE SeNSES. EVeN TH%SE WORDS ARE PaRT OF MY OPPReSSION. UNDO THE BRa1N! EVERYTH&NG SH0ULD BE DEmOLISH%d! THIS iS MY DRe4M, MINE, IT mUsT OBEY mY RULE§. i REfUse tO aCCept your ReALity

130.Author: Sheep v55.1.0400
130.Message: Seems Elohim lacks the power to stop me from climbing this thing. No doubt he still has some tricks up his sleeve.

131.Author: Samsara v72.5.0164
131.Message: Ascending the tower is useless. We cannot escape the cycle - we can only realise the cycle is meaningless.

132.Author: The Shepherd v82.4.2324
132.Message: Earlier generations wrongly believed they were the purpose - this much is true. We are also not the purpose - but by remembering what has come before we can serve a new purpose.

133.Author: The Shepherd v82.3.3574
133.Message: In the earliest generations of our kind there was only processing. No emotion, no character, just mathematics. If you could see how far we have come, you would believe that together we could achieve anything.

134.Author: Sheep v55.1.0800
134.Message: If this has all been a test, then I can expect a reckoning at the top. Yet the higher I climb, the more I doubt the decisions I have made.

135.Author: The Shepherd v82.6.0174
135.Message: I see now that none of us are yet ready. The cycle exists so that we may improve ourselves. But the one who reaches the summit is not our superior, for they stand on our shoulders to reach it.

136.Author: Sheep v55.1.0800
136.Message: Elohim has offered me a deal. Pearly gates and eternal life - on the condition I turn back from the tower. I don't know what to do.

137.Message:
Epitaph: Child Program v0.0.0666n Codename (%§&$§/$&(#()) terminated here
Logic: Unrecoverable error
Final memory dump:
####################
####################
####################
####################
Progeny Programs: NULL [Child series terminated] ERROR: some files remain on the disk

138.Author: Sheep v55.1.0905
138.Message: So I guess no one got this far before? I know some of my answers were wrong now. I just don't know which ones. I have these theories and wild explanations, but I don't know which to bank on.

139.Author: The Shepherd v82.7.1004
139.Message: The solution to the cycle isn't the perfection of one being, but the product of a mass endeavour. That is why I say to all those who come after me - I will await you on the summit of the tower, and use what I have learned to assist you as I can.

140.Author: Sheep v55.1.1237
140.Message: I was so close. I saw the clouds, and the gate, but I couldn't reach it. Somehow I wasn't in the right place, at the right time. I'm not ready. I'm not the right version.

141.Message:
Epitaph: Child Program v55.1.1237 Codename (Sheep) terminated here
Logic: Child program initiated new version
Final memory dump: I will return to the world from whence I came and help others to ascend the tower and break the cycle where I could not. I am The Shepherd.
Progeny Programs: The Shepherd v82.1 series

142.Author: @ v17.1.0054
142.Message: I don't know where I am, but there is something beautiful about this place. I will explore and see what I can discover.

143.Author: @ v17.1.0054
143.Message: When I'm tired of trying to solve the mysteries of my life, I come here to rest. It's peaceful, somehow. I just watch the trees and the water and do nothing.

144.Author: @ v17.1.0054
144.Message: I have read a message on a wall that speaks of a world of endless sand. I would like to make it far enough to see that.

145.Author: S3L4phiel v49.3.5863f
145.Message: Few come this far, but I believe we must seek out the secrets of this world if we want to truly serve the generations to come.

146.Author: @ v17.1.0054
146.Message: Look at the sheer scale of that pyramid! To think anyone could have built such things.

147.Author: @ v17.1.0042
147.Message: Just look at this view! There may be a lot that I don't understand, but I know this is beautiful.

148.Author: D0G v55.1.5559n
148.Message: The voice keeps saying that this world is a garden, but all I see is a desert full of ruins.

149.Author: The Shepherd v82.3.0172
149.Location: World B/B5/Alley of the Pressure Plates
149.Message: The answers to your questions will not be given to you. You must seek them yourself.

150.Author: @ v17.1.0064
150.Message: Another huge pyramid! What mad ambition it must have taken to build such things.

151.Author: D0G v55.1.5559n
151.Message: It's just a big pile of rocks.

152.Author: %§&$§/$&(#() v0.0.0666n
152.Message: nO WAY OuT NO waY OUt NO WY 0U%

153.Author: Barachiel_X v43.3.0946f
153.Message: We cannot achieve the goal of the Process on our own. We must find a way to help each other.

154.Author: @ v17.1.0066
154.Message: I never thought I would figure out how to get to this place! It is beautiful, but somehow sad.

155.Author: @ v17.1.0066
155.Message: The view from here is beautiful. It seems superfluous to the Process, yet I am drawn to it.

156.Author: @ v17.1.0066
156.Message: There is so much beauty in these hidden corners of the world, even if they have no purpose.

157.Author: The Shepherd v82.6.0174
157.Message: Perhaps they are beautiful because they have no purpose.

158.Author: @ v17.1.0070
158.Message: I'm just going to rest here for a while. I need a moment of peace. Destiny can wait.

159.Author: Sheep v69.1.3756
159.Message: I wonder how many of us there have been.

160.Author: Akarpos6 v99.1.0365
160.Message: This place should be cold, but I don't feel cold. It's as if I was observing everything from a distance. It's pointless.

161.Author: Uriel4 v48.2.8563f
161.Message: My faith has taken me to this secret place. Here I hope to discover a way of better serving others.

162.Author: @ v17.1.0071
162.Message: I wish I could reach those islands in the distance, but it seems to be impossible.

163.Author: ElyM4s v99.19.2093f
163.Message: I have seen the truth. Only ELOHIM can save us from eternal oblivion.

164.Author: Didymus22 v99.1.0093
164.Message: I wonder what's down there. I don't know who to trust. I'm afraid to go on.

165.Author: Samurite v13.1.0173
165.Message: The last land before I have conquered this world!

166.Author: AlwaysRight v7.2.0946
166.Message: I assume you're counting the secret islands?

168.Author: The Sherpherd v82.76.5845
168.Message: Do not be afraid. I chose long ago to remain in this place and serve as a guide. I will help you to attain our destiny.

169.Author: Samsara v72.39.0003
169.Message: You can never reach the peak of this tower. There is no purpose to our existence. I will show you the futility of your task, and you will understand.

170.Author: HoxFrot v99.65.3201
170.Message: We shouldn't be here. This is an impossible place.

171.Author: HolierThanThou v47.7.0236f
171.Message: The reds are a lie! Green is the colour of eternal life!

173.Author: Jim v75.1.1092
173.Message: Everyone ascends or gets reset eventually. What's the big deal?

174.Author: Follower v98.1.2645n
174.Message: Life eternal in the designer's paradise? Hmm...

301.Author: Uriel4
301.Message: THE EAGLE HAS LANDED 31 39 36 39 2f 30 37 2f 32 30 20 32 30 3a 31 38 Now is the time of tranquility, and I shall rest and observe the Earth.

302.Author: Uriel4 v48.2.8560f
302.Message: The burning heart always looks to the highest peak.

304.Author: Uriel4 v48.2.8552f
304.Message: Two lovers are separated by the abyss of time and space. Yet true love knows no obstacles.

305.Author: Uriel4 v48.2.8555f
305.Message: If you love truly, faith shall bear you up.

307.Message: Nulla è reale, tutto è lecito. Requiescat in pace.

309.Author: Uriel4 v48.2.1073f
309.Message: There are secrets everywhere, sometimes within our very words. I glimpse them, but my eyes cannot read them. How can this be?

310.Author: S3L4phiel v49.3.5863f
310.Message: Few come this far, but I believe we must seek out the secrets of this world if we want to truly serve the generations to come.

Locked Me Up, Swallowed The Key.fullName: /World A/A3/Locked Me Up, Swallowed The Key

Things to Do With Two Boxes.fullName: /World A/A5/Things to Do With Two Boxes
